note.p: Career: Joint Prothonotary of the Common Pleas of Ireland (1692-1700); Joint Ranger of Phoenix Park and Joint Master of the Game of All Ireland (1698-death); Privy Councillor (Ireland) (1701); Deputy-Lieutenant of Buckinghamshire (1703); MP for Great Marlow (1715-1722); MP Chipping Wycombe (1722-1727); at his death left a fortune of £16,000 a year and £250,000 in the funds
Honours: Viscount Dunkeron and Earl of Shelburne (1719)
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; Hunter; GEC; Sedgwick
